thread.section_title: Teaching Your Baby and Toddler To Sleep - Page 3 - BabyCenter
thread.title: 8 month old waking up too early from naps
thread.title_full: 8 month old waking up too early from naps - BabyCenter

posts.author: michbell212
posts.text:
Wake up between 6 and 7. Nurses.
Floor play time (or I babywear if she’s super clingy)
Solid foods 7 or 8am
Gets tired around 9am but I have to drop my 3 year old off at preschool. It’s a 5 minute drive away but she nods off in the car sometimes. I babywear her in the school. Kiss big brother goodbye, sometimes chit chat with teachers. There’s so much commotion she usually stays awake... sometimes dozed on the way home.
Home again between 9:15/9:30. Nurses and I rock her until She falls asleep. I try to wake her a bit by kissing her cheeks but she’s overtired.
Awake 20 minutes later.
Not an hour passes before she’s grumpy again. I hold her and talk to her until she’s rubbing her eyes and I rock her to sleep. We do the same song and dance for much of the morning. My son was going to school until 12:30 but I actually upped his hours to 2:30pm in the hopes of getting her more on track. Nope.
2:10pm: This is wear the day gets wonky because if it’s nice out, I try to get my son outside playing and I babywear her. She’ll catnap in her Tula often. This is likely my problem? It’s just so hard because I live in a 3rd floor apartment so I feel guilty keeping him all cooped up... especially after a long day at school.
Always home by 5:30 for dinner. How she napped on any given day is anyone’s guess but I try to stretch her out. 6pm her bath, 6:15 her brothers bath. She hangs out in a bouncy while he plays and I play some special bedtime songs on my phone. Same songs every night.
When the playlist is done, my son knows to get out of the bath. I brush his teeth, pajamas. She watches.
My husband comes home at his point. We both read a book... sometimes my daughter is so very very tired she needs to leave early.
She gets a sleep sack, white noise. a lovey. Nurses. I wake her up and she cries. I put her down.
Screams bloody murder for one minute. I pick her up. Screams bloody murder for 3 minutes. I pick her up and soothe her
Cries herself to sleep always before the 5 minute mark. Sometimes 1 minute, sometimes 4. Varies.
I cry a bit too, but at least our night’s are ok. One wake up for a feed... down again no drama.
Let me know if there’s anything else that would be useful? Typing fast and on the go now!

thread.section_title: Teaching Your Baby and Toddler To Sleep - Page 3 - BabyCenter
thread.title: 8 month old waking up too early from naps
thread.title_full: 8 month old waking up too early from naps - BabyCenter

posts.author: lorihanifan
posts.text:
At bedtime, I would move the last nursing to the beginning of the bedtime routine, instead of the end of the bedtime routine, and then make sure you're putting down WIDE AWAKE.
Something more like:
Dinner, nurse, bath, diaper, pjs, read 1 quick book, quick 1-2 minute cuddle/rock/song, then into crib WIDE AWAKE.
During the day, I would be following wake times, not any kind of set, by-the-clock schedule.
I would also switch up your daytime feeding schedule, to more of an EASY schedule, so you're feeding directly after sleep periods, instead of beforehand.
Something more like:
7:00am wake up
7:15am nurse
8:00am breakfast
10:00am-11:00am nap 1 (WT 3 hrs)
11:15am nurse
12:00pm lunch
2:30pm-3:30pm nap 2 (WT 3.5 hrs)
3:45pm nurse
5:00pm dinner
6:15pm last nurse
6:30pm start bedtime routine
7:00pm bedtime (WT 3.5 hrs)
This link can be very helpful:
kidspluspgh.com/wp-content/uploads/...

thread.section_title: Teaching Your Baby and Toddler To Sleep - Page 3 - BabyCenter
thread.title: 8 month old waking up too early from naps
thread.title_full: 8 month old waking up too early from naps - BabyCenter

posts.author: michbell212
posts.title: 8 month old waking up too early from naps
posts.text:
For the life of me I cannot figure out how to get my child to sleep longer at nap time! Today she has taken 20 minute naps ON THE HOUR and it’s driving me bananas.
At night, we’ve been ferberizing after a good solid night routine for a month now. She never cries more than 5 minutes but she still screams herself to sleep every night, which makes me feel awful and depressed every night. She wakes up once around 3 or 4am to nurse and usually goes down again without drama.
She seems so awake when she pops up after 20 minutes. It feels cruel to let her cry, but should I? At least at night I KNOW she’s tired.
She spends much of the day fussy (from being tired because of these crap naps maybe?)
I was hoping being consistent with sleep training would leak over to day too, but it’s so hard. 😞
Any guidance appreciated but I understand if this is just something I need to trudge through. Is she just a bit difficult overall and I need to accept it? Thanks for reading my vent!

posts.author: CoderMomma
posts.text: Not sure if it’s a fluke, but I went and did my grocery shopping this morning to help push LO (little one) to the 2 hour wake time mark. He has now been asleep for his morning nap for 1hr 16min. He never naps this long this early in the day. Thank you for letting me know I could push his wake time even if I know he’s already getting sleepy! Everything always says put them down at the first tired cue, so it hadn’t even occurred to me to push him further.

thread.title: Bedtime for 4 month old
thread.title_full: Bedtime for 4 month old - BabyCenter

posts.author: maryterp1212
posts.text:
Sounds like it's time to stat putting him down to sleep without the boob, so he's awake at put-down. You can start by implementing a bedtime/nap routine where you move BFing to the beginning of the routine. So for bedtime, it might be nurse, change into PJs, sing a song, put down awake. He will fuss some, but you can go in and comfort him, every 5-10 mins or so, etc. It will definitely be easier once he can roll both directions!
Also check out the sticky to be sure you're following age-appropriate wake and sleep times. Sounds like his overnight sleep is going well, so maybe that's all fine.
Once you have bedtime sleep going well, then tackle the naps and start putting him down for naps awake and in the PNP. Good luck!

posts.author: txgirl7
posts.title: Target Gift Card with Purchase Question
posts.text:
Random couponer question:
Target is doing one of their deals where you get a $20 gift card if you spend $100 on baby products.
Does anyone know if it has to total $100 BEFORE other discounts and coupons, or after?
For example, I purchase $100 worth of diapers but have $5 in coupons, making my total $95. Do I still qualify for the $20 bonus gift card?
Another example, I have $100 worth of qualifying baby items on my registry & use my 15% registry completion coupon, making my total now $85. Would this count for the $20?
I've started couponing at CVS for diapers & wipes this summer. CVS seems to be pretty generous with the order in which they stack coupons. My local grocery store kinda sucks when it comes to using coupons. Trying to figure out Target's system now!
Thanks!!

thread.title: Target Gift Card with Purchase Question
thread.title_full: Target Gift Card with Purchase Question - BabyCenter

posts.author: 1sttimemom61015
posts.text:
I tend to coupon as well. I have a 2 year old and he wears any diapers that's on sale. Once you figure out what your baby prefers than you'll get an idea of the cost of diapers.
From my experience the best deal at target is when you spend $100 on baby products you get a $25 gift card. I've seen this promotion rotate, so that's when I stock up in diapers. As for wipes I buy what ever is on sale at Costco.
Best value to me is the target and luv brand. Anyways, I tend to coupon on house hold supplies to so PM me if you have any more questions.

thread.title: Target Gift Card with Purchase Question
thread.title_full: Target Gift Card with Purchase Question - BabyCenter

posts.author: 1sttimemom61015
posts.text:
Yes.
For example you buy $100 worth of diapers and you have $10 off of coupons, cartwheel, and any form of discount. You'll get that $20 giftcard.

posts.author: hcsig

Get rid of it! How long has this stuff been in the garage? It all sounds like it can be replaced easily
Twin sheets, I often find for less than $10 on sale. Plus I am sure your DS (dear son) would think it is cool to pick out new sheets with his bed.
Old towels is nice for painting, so maybe keep one and then invest in a cheap drop cloth for when you eventually paint. Or give yourself a timeline, if I don't paint by x date I will donate to animal shelter
With the paintings go through and find a home for them...if you can't within a certain time frame you probably never will

Also, should I just expect to naps to be about an hour from here on until we make the switch?

thread.section_title: Teaching Your Baby and Toddler To Sleep - Page 4 - BabyCenter

thread.title_full: 10 month old showing signs of 2-1? - BabyCenter

posts.author: brooke410
posts.text: I had the exact opposite problem in that she was always a crazy long napper, hence why I had to limit naps. If you extend her WT, you may see naps extending as well. We had BT at 8 for a while leading up to 2-1. Once I got to the point where bedtime was consistently pushing 8:00 even with limited naps, I knew it was time.

thread.section_title: Teaching Your Baby and Toddler To Sleep - Page 4 - BabyCenter
thread.title: 10 month old showing signs of 2-1?
thread.title_full: 10 month old showing signs of 2-1? - BabyCenter

posts.author: brooke410
posts.text: You still have quite a bit of leeway here in your schedule before 2-1 needs to happen. At 10 months, we were doing something like 3.25/3.5-3.75/3-3.5. We didn't do 2-1 until she was at 3.75-4 for FWT and I think we held on to something like 3.75-4/4/3 for as long as we could until I finally got fed up with limiting naps and she filly transitioned around 13 months. You've got some time.

posts.author: Ashley1589
posts.title: Sleep help!
posts.text: Hi. My LO (little one) is two months old and used to fall asleep on my boob at night. I’ve been reading up on good sleep habits and realized we shouldn’t be doing this. During the day the only way he will nap is on me in his carrier. I have been trying to start with rocking him to drowsy and putting him down for night sleep and then I’ll move to naps. He hates being rocked in the cradle position. He screams and it has been taking an hour and a half to get him to sleep. I try to get him to sleep within an hour of his last nap but it takes so long that he becomes so ot and angry. If I rock him sitting up on my shoulder he just looks around even in a dark room. Any suggestions!?!? Taking an hour and a half to get him to sleep is driving me crazy!

thread.section_title: Teaching Your Baby and Toddler To Sleep - Page 4 - BabyCenter
thread.title: Don't know where to start w sleep associations!
thread.title_full: Don't know where to start w sleep associations! - BabyCenter

posts.author: CHSmommy
posts.text:
Jump in and do it all at once. There will be crying, but it's probably less than you think and it's the fastest way.
Sleepy signs are not reliable at this age anymore, so go with wake times, not sleepy signs, to determine naps and bedtime. You're looking for wake times in the 1.75-2 hour range right now, and 3-4 naps. If she naps a decent amount, I would do 3 naps and something like 1.75/2/2/1.75-2 for wake times. Early bedtime is fine if that's where the wake times put you.
You also want to switch to putting her down wide awake at bedtime, not drowsy at all. Switch the last feeding to the beginning of the bedtime routine and limit any rocking so she's going down wide awake.
Use a cut-off for feedings. I would do 1 single feeding, at least 7-8 hours into her night. Adding back a feeding is a bad idea, because she's just shifting calories to the night, which is unnecessary and interferes with her rest. For wake-ups outside the cutoff, the absolute fastest way to go is CIO: 1 check after 10 minutes, and then leave her until she falls asleep. The intensity of her cry has nothing to do with whether this will work. It's normal for her to be angry because you're switching things up on her. If you're consistent, it will hopefully work fast.

thread.section_title: Teaching Your Baby and Toddler To Sleep - Page 4 - BabyCenter
thread.title: My 14 month old dropped his second nap but he’s so cranky!!! Any suggestions?
thread.title_full: My 14 month old dropped his second nap but he’s so cranky!!! Any suggestions? - BabyCenter

posts.author: olivefarmer
posts.text:
Distract, distract, distract. If he's refusing the second nap regularly (not surprising at 14 months) you don't have many more options than dropping to 1 nap, provided that's on the proper schedule.
Your other option is to push nap one out to 3.75 hours, then 4 hours before nap 2, then about 3 before bed. That could help for now but 2-1 is inevitable.

thread.section_title: Teaching Your Baby and Toddler To Sleep - Page 4 - BabyCenter
thread.title: My 14 month old dropped his second nap but he’s so cranky!!! Any suggestions?
thread.title_full: My 14 month old dropped his second nap but he’s so cranky!!! Any suggestions? - BabyCenter

posts.author: olivefarmer
posts.text:
3 hours wake time is just too early for a 1 nap schedule. He's cranky because the second wake time is just so long. It needs
to be 4 hours minimally and then 6 before bed, or as early as you can muster with work.

thread.section_title: Teaching Your Baby and Toddler To Sleep - Page 4 - BabyCenter
thread.title: Preparing for Ferber Methks
thread.title_full: Preparing for Ferber Methks - BabyCenter

posts.author: lorihanifan
posts.text:
Schedule wise, I would limit each nap to one hour max, and do bedtime closer to 7:00pm.
At bedtime, make sure any last bottle/nursing is at the beginning of the bedtime routine, limit any rocking to just 1-2 minutes max, and then make sure you're putting down WIDE AWAKE.
Something more like:
Dinner, nurse/bottle, bath, diaper, pjs, read 1 quick book, quick 1-2 minute cuddle/rock/song, then into crib WIDE AWAKE.
This link can be very helpful:
kidspluspgh.com/wp-content/uploads/...

thread.section_title: Teaching Your Baby and Toddler To Sleep - Page 4 - BabyCenter
thread.title: Preparing for Ferber Methks
thread.title_full: Preparing for Ferber Methks - BabyCenter

posts.author: Nmlinarich
posts.title: Preparing for Ferber Methks
posts.text: Hi Mommies. My 8 month old was sleeping through the night and has regressed to waking every hour and needing to be rocked asleep. I know we are responsible for creating sleep association and would like to fix them, he needs a better nights rest. He wakes at 7am, typically has 2, one to two hour naps and doesn't go to bed until 9pm. After talking with o ur pediatrician we have decided to try the Ferber method. Although I know there are not long term side effects of letting him cry, I am very apprehensive. I know he is going to bawl his precious eyes out and just thinking about it brings tears to my eyes. So as we get ready to embark on this journey, I am looking for advice to make it go as smoothly as possible. Or tips to help me hold myself together... thank you ♡

thread.section_title: Teaching Your Baby and Toddler To Sleep - Page 4 - BabyCenter
thread.title: 3rd baby but need some help
thread.title_full: 3rd baby but need some help - BabyCenter

posts.author: KyMama09
posts.title: 3rd baby but need some help
posts.text:
With my first 2 kids I coslept. Baby #3 is 3 weeks old and we have her in her bassinet as my 2 yr old is still in our bed.
DD (dear daughter) sleeps good sometimes then other days she hardly sleeps. She looks like she's asleep but once you lay her down she has them eyes open. If I lay her down still drowsy she will start crying so I pick her back up. She loves to suck but constantly spits the paci out or gets her hands a going and pulls it out. It's like the only time she wants to sleep is while being held but it's not a deep sleep. It's a very light sleep like a cat nap. Is there anything we can do to get her in a deep Sleep?
Last night she was up at 8:30pm (which is fine as my 2yr old goes to bed at 9pm) took her upstairs and got her diaper changed and pjs on and fed her as it was time to eat. Then I rock her and her brother while reading a story. Generally she's asleep and can lay her down but some days it's like she doesn't fall in a deep sleep and immediately wakes back up fussing. Last night was one of them nights (yesterday too) and I didn't get her completely asleep and in her own bed until after 4am when I laid her on my bed on a pillow until she was asleep (or looked like it) then I moved her and the pillow to her bed. (And I know nothing is supposed to be in the bed with them but I needed some sleep and this was the only way it happened). Anyone have any experience with This? With my boys they were good so long as they could touch me while falling asleep, then I could lay them down and so long as it was quiet they would stay asleep. Not her, she's like the queen of cat naps and being aware lol. Please help. I go back to work in 3 weeks and need to get this resolved. She has done this since birth off and on

thread.section_title: Teaching Your Baby and Toddler To Sleep - Page 4 - BabyCenter
thread.title: Bedtime or Another Nap?
thread.title_full: Bedtime or Another Nap? - BabyCenter

posts.author: HeatherNicoleH
posts.text:
In case this helps anyone else:
I figured out my issue. She was too over tired from not napping (Four 30 min naps is not enough for her). She can put herself to sleep from wide awake for naps, but only sleeps for 30 min. I have discovered that I need to hold her for at least one long nap to get her closer to that 7:30 bedtime. Early bedtime isn't working for us yet.
Last night I held her for an hour and a half nap at the end of the day. Last nap was finished at 5:25PM. I put her in the crib at 7:05, she fussed a little. My husband went up for a couple minutes, she fussed a tiny bit more and was asleep by: 7:25 for the night.
I just need to bridge the 30 min nap gap for the time being, until she can consolidate her day sleep herself. It's a huge challenge with a 3 year old too, but I'm going to try to do one longer nap a day.

thread.title: Polyhydramnios & GD
thread.title_full: Polyhydramnios & GD - BabyCenter

posts.author: EmmaleighAnalyse
posts.text: On your question, I had a TON of fluid with my non-GD 6th child. They told me I had an abnormally large amount but nothing came of it. The only "bad" thing was that when my water broke in labor it just kept coming and coming and coming and I felt like I was peeing every contraction because so much "water" kept coming. They kept having to replace the pad things I was sitting on because there was so much. My baby was normal size and all the other things with her birth were normal. I pushed her out in 1 push. Maybe all the water helped?

thread.title: Polyhydramnios & GD
thread.title_full: Polyhydramnios & GD - BabyCenter

posts.author: 10srysk
posts.title: Polyhydramnios & GD
posts.text:
I had a growth scan this morning (33w4d) and little guy is measuring an estimated whopping 6 lbs! Holy crap.
Anyway, we discussed that I'll likely be induced at 39ish weeks. The last thing my OB did was my uterus measurement, and it came in at 40. I mean, whoa. She off-handedly said many GD moms have excess amniotic fluid and we kind of laughed about my belly being full-term.
Fast forward to like 30 mins ago, and I decided to google it. Worst. Mistake. Ever.
My question is... does anyone know anything or have details about this? Non-scary stories? My OB didn't seem worried, but now I'm a little freaked out.

thread.title: Polyhydramnios & GD
thread.title_full: Polyhydramnios & GD - BabyCenter

posts.author: married0805
posts.text: Did they tell you what your water measured? I've had the same as pp, so much water that I gushed and gushed until baby was born. They were all healthy babies. This baby my water measured 20.5 cm at 33 weeks, which is a lot. Last week it measured 11cm, which is in normal range. So it can change.

thread.title: Breakfast numbers always high!!! Super frustrated
thread.title_full: Breakfast numbers always high!!! Super frustrated - BabyCenter

posts.author: Zimphella
posts.text:
Well, for me personally, oats of any kind spike me high as does toast. You may not be getting enough protein with those carbs. Try a slice of whole wheat toast with PB and see what that does.
I tend to eat a protein bar with 10g of protein and an individual bag of skinny pop popcorn (9g of carb), and that puts me around 100 or so for breakfast.

thread.title: Starting insulin this week
thread.title_full: Starting insulin this week - BabyCenter

posts.author: lindsaychristine
posts.title: Starting insulin this week
posts.text: That's kinda where I had been. I've been on the diet for about 5 weeks and my fastings have always hovered around 95 but can get up to low 100s at random times. I think my nutritionist wanted to give my body time to see if it would adjust and for me to try some things first (increasing protein at night, exercising at night, etc) but nothing has dropped them into the 80s. I suppose I'm happy overall because I don't need to worry about the increased glucose baby is getting while I sleep. My daytime numbers are still controllable right now, so I'm praying they stay that way. I'm 30 weeks this week! So will plenty of time to go!

thread.title: Starting insulin this week
thread.title_full: Starting insulin this week - BabyCenter

posts.author: dejahunt
posts.text: I have been on the border of high fasting numbers, I thought they'd put me on insulin after higher than 95 four days last week, but my case manager nurse gave me a few things to try and asked me to check in Thursday. I was honestly starting to feel relieved that I wouldn't have to stress about fasting numbers anymore.

thread.title: GD - how do you know what your BB is measuring or weighing in at?
thread.title_full: GD - how do you know what your BB is measuring or weighing in at? - BabyCenter

posts.author: lindsaychristine
posts.text: I only know baby's size because I'm required to do growth scans once per month and ultrasounds twice a week now due to preexisting hypertension. The GD just further complicated things

thread.title: GD - how do you know what your BB is measuring or weighing in at?
thread.title_full: GD - how do you know what your BB is measuring or weighing in at? - BabyCenter

posts.author: married0805
posts.text:
Measuring a week ahead or behind isn't a big deal. I've measured both ways when they've measured the fundal height at the appointment.
They've also measured baby twice in the last month or so with ultrasound and they give me the baby's estimated weight then (which can be way off.)

thread.title: GD - how do you know what your BB is measuring or weighing in at?
thread.title_full: GD - how do you know what your BB is measuring or weighing in at? - BabyCenter

posts.author: claudialimerick
posts.title: GD - how do you know what your BB is measuring or weighing in at?
posts.text:
Fundal height is pretty inaccurate regardless. And even growth ultrasounds can be off by quite a bit. I usually measured about 3-4 weeks ahead by fundal height. And I had one growth scan at 36 weeks (because I am obese, not because of GD) - and they were estimating LO (little one) would be 8.5 pounds at least by 40 weeks. She wasn't born until 41w2d and was only 7 lb 3 oz.
Long and short - they can't tell you definitively how large or small your baby is. They can try to make estimates sometimes, but really, I wouldn't push for any extra measures like that unless you have other complicating factors. They more they start scanning you, the more likely you are to have unnecessary interventions, which starts you toward a path for a more complicated birth.

thread.section_title: Miscarriage, Stillbirth, & Infant Loss Support - Page 2 - BabyCenter
thread.title: Am I wrong to be upset? *Possible trigger*
thread.title_full: Am I wrong to be upset? *Possible trigger* - BabyCenter

posts.author: Cathie923
posts.title: Am I wrong to be upset? *Possible trigger*
posts.text:
*Possible Trigger*
My daughter was stillborn in May. She was due Sept. 23. Well.. one week after her due date my brother and his wife asked if we could meet them for dinner. My SO (significant other) was working so my little 2 kids and I went alone. When I opened the menu I saw a big sticker that said "we're expecting". At first it didn't hit me that they were expecting and in my head I was thinking "wtf is this some kind of sick joke" but then I saw their faces and realized THEY were expecting. I just started sobbing. I genuinely AM happy for them. But I am heartbroken too. I feel like they could've told me in private or at least when I had someone with me. I acted like all of the crying were happy tears but they weren't. I am crushed and just sad they'd tell me in such a public place when I was alone with my kids. Am I wrong?
Praying I am blessed with my rainbow soon so I can deal with the next 9 months...

thread.section_title: Miscarriage, Stillbirth, & Infant Loss Support - Page 2 - BabyCenter
